node.title: Judge John Hodgman on Whether His Letters Are Real or Not
node.description: Donâ€™t believe me? Tell it to my fact checker.
node.content: ["Ryan writes: My wife insists that the letters you print in The Times Magazine are fake, and does so in a sneering fashion. Will you please tell her she is wrong, and order her to refrain from being condescending?", "Your wife is wrong: You are a real person. The letters are real, sent to me via hodgman@maximumfun.org. And while some disputes have tested even my credulity (the dad who gave his kids peanut butter and tuna fish for breakfast; the woman who wanted a diaphonized kitten \u2014 don\u2019t Google it!), they are all verified by the magazine\u2019s brave and patient fact checkers. (Special shout-out to researcher Tim H., who in verifying a dispute sent in by one \u201cPaul\u201d was treated to \u201cseveral more arguments\u201d for why a dragon\u2019s tail should be considered part of the dragon\u2019s butt.) By now you will have heard from one of these essential people. I hope you told them thank you. ", ""]
